intro: Lessingia tenuis var. jaredii, commonly known as the narrowleaf lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor nutrient conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. This variety is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
